intro: Sabazia portoriccensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salt spray. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
